cons: Lots of lazy people Who should work somewhere else

pros: Dedicated coworkers, decent benefits, steady employment, the residents are the reason I stay.
cons: Ineffective upper management that can be dismissive of their employees, lower than average pay with a few exceptions, resources are often spent in the wrong places, constantly changing guidelines that feel like they were decided arbitrarily, some challenging behaviors to deal with (staff and clients).

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Peapack, NJ
cons: Frequently short staffed, as most medical facilities are during pandemic.

pros: Wonderful staff, patient/client interactions is great, amazing learning environment

No feedback/input in hiring process of personnel that you are in charge of
Limits in career advancement.

job_title: Primary Registered Nurse in Peapack, NJ
pros: the patients, the other nurses, manager
cons: PCAs bull each other and nurses

pros: This special services hospital serves a very special population
cons: Because this is a non-profit growth is limited

pros: If you care about children and adults with complex disabilities, this place will help you find meaning in your work.  You will find coworkers who care about the people they serve, and who work hard to make Matheny a good place for them.
cons: The current administration has serious problems communicating with employees, defining their roles, and practicing themselves what they they preach.  The result is a work environment where employees feel disrespected, disengaged, and unsure about their future.  Decisions that effect employees are made in what seems to be a random fashion with little input from employees and little communication about what went into those decisions.

review_title: Many Excellent Programs for Persons with Cerebral Palsy but Serious Doubts About the School
pros:
Wonderful programs for adults and children with cerebral palsy and other physical and cognitive disabilities.
PTs, OTs, and other support staff are very caring
Music therapy and arts programs are excellent
Many highly dedicated teachers for students PK -21
cons: Working in the school as a paraprofessional was a terrible experience.  Senior managment was very condescending and unprofessional, even trying to sabotage the teaching job I took at another school when I was dismissed from Matheny, with no warning or reason given.  I know of other teaching and secretarial staff who were dismissed with no reason given or opportunity to recitify the situation.  Other departments might be fine, but I would not recommend working for the school.

review_title: Meaningful work, but PAPER paperwork/charts/MAR; very dated method of RN practice
pros: Good starting, new grad pay. Meaningful work.
cons: All paper charting, MAR, etc makes med passing tedious flipping back and forth through pages of a battered binder. No computer program to double check med admin, alert you to late meds, etc.

pros: Staff are committed; it's rewarding to work at a place where you know people with the most complex disabilities are getting quality health and educational services
cons: The organization, to a large extent, is at the mercy of state funders.  Sometimes a sense of instability flows through the organization.
